name: Lunch Break - Afternoon Route Planning
content: Lena taking lunch break at base camp after morning hike to 2100m. Planning afternoon ridge trail to 2400m elevation via northwest route, estimated 3-hour round trip with 5:30 PM sunset consideration. Assessed conditions: good snow, no avalanche risk at current elevations. Prepared safety gear: emergency bivvy, extra layers for temperature drops, redundant navigation (GPS, compass, paper map). Packed provisions: 2L water, energy bars, nuts, chocolate. Maintained critical safety protocols: first aid kit and satellite communicator always in pack. Reflected on solo hiking advantages: self-paced movement, freedom to pause and appreciate views without group pressure. Expressed appreciation for independence and flexibility. Eating dehydrated chicken and rice, targeting 1:30 PM ridge departure.
summary: Lunch planning: mapped 2400m ridge hike, prepared safety gear, appreciated solo flexibility, targeting 1:30 PM departure
background_sounds: wind, birds, water boiling on stove, paper map rustling
